title: How to choose right career after 12th - Quora

response.answer_text: It is too early in life for you to choose a career. Please keep in mind career is AFTER you have done something, not what you plan to do. What you are anxious about is which profession you should go into. Anxiety will always make you take a wrong decision. Take it easy, go step by step - first choose your basic education (graduation onwards) wisely. You have to chose what basic education you should take to become competent for a profession. For that, you will have to look at yourself, your likes and dislikes, and most of all what you are good / bad at. Only you know that; others know nothing about it - even your parentsIf you are not proficient in Maths, there are a lot of choices which are not meant for you: Engineering, Physics, Economics, Statistics etc. If you hate the sight of injuries and blood, medical studies is not the line to take. If you are not able to relate to business and industry, Commerce is not for you. Conversely, if you like the idea of teaching, just about ANY line is good. Or if you are really persevering in research, a PhD in Engineering, Physics, Biological Sciences etc. is the direction to take. Doing Arts is a good choice if you want to target getting into Civil Services etc.Don’t let anyone try to convince you that success is guaranteed by doing MBA after a graduation in any subject. The only job you will ever get by that is in low-level Sales or Marketing. For deserving anything serious, you will have to get work experience of a few years before doing MBA - you will not understand anything taught in MBA otherwiseYour choice of profession will change many times between now and when it is the time to choose a professionSuccess shouldn’t be the goal of life. Whatever you do, put in your best - you are bound to succeed. Don’t take shortcuts - it never pays!Don’t try to do what you love to do (people taking this route fail most often) - love whatever you doDON’T chase money. If it is ordained for you, it will come. What matters is a balanced life, a balance between professional achievement and personal / family needs. If you chase money, you will realize after a very long time what you have lost in the bargain. And it will be too late then!

You have to connect your passion with your abilities and then connect with the opportunities to decide about your career destination. If you are a happy go lucky person, not so studious, yet very creative and passionate about new concepts, ideas and research, extrovert and fond of communicating with people - then for you my prescription would be humanities - English, Psychology, Philosophy, Political Studies, Mass Communication, Journalism, Social Studies. If you are not interested in Science subjects, but very much creative and wants to earn good packages after Graduation, not so studious but passionate about creating something new and interested about art and design, my suggestion for you would be Designing - Fashion Designing, Product Designing, Interior Designing, Automobile and Transport Designing, Lifestyle and Accessories, Industrial Designing, Visual Communicstion and Graphic Designing, Gaming and Animstion designing etc. If you are not good in Science subjects, specially in Mathematics, then dont break your head for Medical or Engineering. If you are passionate about IT sector, but not good in Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics, then dont go for 3rd category Engineering Colleges. Instead go for Graphic Designing and Visual Communication or Gaming and Animation or something like UX designing which will make you land into IT companies with very good pay packages. If you are fond if Commerce as a subject and coming from.a Corporate or Business background, then go for BCOM or BBA or BBA plus LLB. For hospitality industries, go for BHM i.e. Bachelor in Hotel Management or Hospitality Management. Otherwise if you are studious and sincere and hardworking, and a very good and Meritorious student with patience, then go for the traditional CA, Cost Accountancy, Engineering and Medical. For Humanities, Management, Design and Law subjects, you can go for Karnavati University at Gandhinagar Gujarat which is trending to be one of the best University interms of infrastructure, Faculty resources and Placements. There are many other career options. You dont have to necessarily pursue with Science or Commerce subjects to prove yourself superior in the society. These days, most of the opportunities are in Humanities where you can have a free space of mind to feel education from.within and can use your creativity and communication skill to excel in the much preferred Media and Entertainment Industry. Listen to your heart, speak to your mind, think about your abilities and connect with the opportunities. This is the best way to decide about your career.

There are plenty of things which you can do after 12th to make your right career choice. I will suggest you some tips , methods ,procedure and right strategy to make your better career choice after completing your 12th. First of all I am going to talk about several tips via which you will better understand to make right career choice:- Analyze your past taught subjects . Those subjects or stream which you had been studying in your 11th and 12th .Analyze and evaluate that whether you are interested in previous subjects or not .Then , if you are interested in your previous subjects make the list of courses which you can do after your 12th according to your subjects taught in 11th and 12th.Let me elaborate this you with an example:- Suppose your 12th subjects were physics,chemistry and mathmatics then make list of courses which you can do like btech bsc etcSuppose you have studied commerce as stream then make the list of courses like bba ,bcom,bms etc.These are choices which you can make on your previous taught subjects. Now I am going to talk about courses you can do according to your passion or hobby . It is not necessary for these courses to have any previous record . Anyone can do these courses and make a bright career . Several courses are there :- BACHELOR IN HOSPITALITY MANAGEMENTBACHELOR IN TOURISM AND AVIATION MANAGEMENTBACHELOR IN MASS COMMUNICATIONMULTIMEDIA AND ANIMATIONBACHELOR IN FASHION DESIGNINGBACHELOR OF FINE ARTSCINEMATOGRAPHYThere are several more courses which you can do after 12th according to your passion and interestNow, I am going to focus on about short term courses which you can do after 12th to get an early job based on your preference :- DIPLOMA IN RETAIL MANAGEMENTDIPLOMA IN TOURISM MANAGEMENTDIPLOMA IN ANCHORINGDIPLOMA IN FASHION DESIGNINGDIPLOMA IN FOREIGN LANGUAGESDIPLOMA IN TEXTILE AND LEATHER DESIGNINGDIPLOMA IN MULTIMEDIA ,3D ANIMATION & VISUAL EFFECTSDIPLOMA IN HOTEL MANAGEMENTDIPLOMA IN FOOD AND BEVERAGE SERVICESDIPLOMA IN ADVERTISING & MARKETINGDIPLOMA IN PHOTOGRAPHYI hope this will make you understand much in a better way to make your good career ahead.

It’s important to figure out what you are good at. Not your friends, not your parents or your relatives, but you. You must realize that you shouldn’t come under pressure to choose a certain stream or career just because your family or your friends said so. You need to do what you are good at. And you will only find that out once you know your strengths. When it comes to choosing a career, your college or course, don’t choose what is most convenient. Choose what will intellectually stimulate you and motivate you to make a good career. In the meantime, you have the opportunity to join a host of extra-curricular activities. Who knows? You might find your passion in theatre or dance! College is a great way to find out what you really want to do with your life. I listed some programme after 12th you can choose according to your interest: BBA ( Bachelors of Business) BBA (Bachelor of Business Administration) is one of the most sought bachelor degree programmes after 12th. It includes complete knowledge of leadership and management. BBA degree allows the candidates to enter in the field of management. This degree teaches the students with various aspects that are necessary for effective business management and essential for entrepreneurs and business managers. BBA specializations: Finance Marketing Operation Human Resources (HR) Accounting Supply Chain International Business Logistics and Supply Chain Organizational Behavior Planning Retail Strategic Bachelors of Commerce (B. Com): This is the general degree that spans over a period of 3 years that you can pursue after completing your 12th commerce. Having a normal B. Com. degree proves quite handy even if you are pursuing any of the professional courses. It is always beneficial to complete your graduation that may help you later on if you go for higher studies. Bachelors of Commerce (Honours) or B. Com. (Hons): This is similar to B. Com. but in an extensive form with specialization in a particular subject or field like Accountancy, management or economics etc. The industry demand for B. Com. (Honours) is somewhat better than normal B. Com. However, the admission criteria and eligibility conditions might be similar for both. These may slightly vary for different universities/colleges. Bachelors in Economics: This is yet another option for commerce students to pursue after their higher secondary education. You will get to experience practical knowledge on various economic concepts, economic policies, analytical methods and programs etc. If you are keenly interested in economic and want to gain specialization about the economic framework, this might suit you. Bachelors of Commerce (Honours) or B. Com. (Hons): This is similar to B. Com. but in an extensive form with specialization in a particular subject or field like Accountancy, management or economics etc. The industry demand for B. Com. (Honours) is somewhat better than normal B. Com. However, the admission criteria and eligibility conditions might be similar for both. These may slightly vary for different universities/colleges. Design Programme Design Studies is a leading international academic journal focused on developing understanding of design processes. It studies design activity across all domains of application, including engineering and product design, architectural and urban design, computer artefacts and systems design. B.Design (Fashion) B.Design (Interior & Furniture) B.Design (Product & Industrial) B.Design (Multimedia) B.Design (Graphics) B.Design (Film and TV Production) Hotel Management Programme Hotel Management is an area of study that covers a wide range of topics concerned with the operational aspects of hoteliery. Educational courses in hotel management are varied and cover topics as wide ranging as marketing, eco-tourism, leisure, business administration and management. Bachelor of Hotel Mgt. and Catering Technology (BHMCT) (4 years) BSc. (Hotel Management) (3 years) BSc. (Airlines, Tourism and Hospitality) Agriculture Agriculture is the cultivation and breeding of animals, plants and fungi for food, fiber, biofuel, medicinal plants and other products used to sustain and enhance life. BSc. (Hons.) Agriculture Building expertise through well planned on-field implementation and testing of basic concepts in production, yield enhancement disease resistant and better shelf life of food and flora. Fine arts Fine art is something created for aesthetic or intellectual value rather than utilitarian or practical purpose. It might convey an idea or an emotion or explore social commentary. The concept of ''art for art's sake,'' originated in the late 19th and early 20th centuries, with the rise of abstract art - art that exists for its own purpose. B A Fine Arts (Painting) 3 Years BFA (Painting) 4 Years course BFA (Applied Art) 4 Years BFA (Sculpture) 4 Years course BFA (Photography) 4Years course BFA (Printmaking) 4 Years course Performing Arts Performing arts are all pervading bringing colour and joy to numerous festivals and ceremonies, and reaffirming the faith of the people in their heritage. These facets have been responsible for sustaining the long continuities of ancient traditions. B.A. (Music Tabla) B.A. (Theatre) B.A. (Music Vocal) BPA (Music Tabla) BPA (Theatre) List of top universities that offer these programmes: St. Xavier's College Mumbai Lovely Professional University, Jalandhar Loyola College, Chennai St. Stephen's College, Delhi

HOW TO CHOOSE CAREER AFTER EDUCATION/ GRADUATION words- 939 reading time-3 min 35 sec DON'T BE PANIC Well, This a stage of life where some fresh students having a big dream in life come after college and face the real world, and they have no idea what to do and how to do next? But the regret sight is 70% of students have not that much capacity or potential to be at a good job or a good career. DIFFERENCE BETWEEN OLD AND NEW AGE when someone going online and searching for what is the best smartphone in the price range of 10000, he gets confused. which handset should he buy? Like that, when you are searching for a good salary option, you are getting confused. When our parents are studying in theiryoung age, there were not so many career options that are now available in the market. They have to choose a job for a career, or there are such limited options. Almost it can be a teacher or a CA or could be in any government or private sector job as well. But now if you go to finding a job in the market, there are vast options in every field.   FOLLOW YOUR PASSION Alright, some students settle down their careers very soon, and some students get a job or starting a business later in life. It totally depends upon what is your belief system is and what you want to be. I will say if you won't get a job to follow your passion. Passion has such energy that you can travel to your destination. I will want to say some students have nothing in their life. They are like 5th class students what they told to do. They do that, but if you are reading this, I will say you are not between them. Nowadays, every work has significant scope for success. When someone asks the very successful person in the world, if you have 100 hours to invest in some work and works are you are very good at something or average at somethingand bad at something, Which one will you prefer and how much time will you give to which work? what do you think which had to get more hours? Let's see what your opinion is .please comment below. They all say they will give 100% hours in which they are good at. cream of the story is whatever your parents and society are telling you to do, don't listen to them. Choose your career according to your passion. It can be getting a good job. which you are good at, it can be photography, YouTube, blogging, network marketing, or it can be some other business. ACTIVE AND PASSIVE SIGHT OF MONEY Listen, there can be two types of income nowadays. It can be active or passive income. If you working actively in some work and revenue is producing that is active work and If you create a business model once it will pay you life long and after your death also that is a passive income source. YOUR STRATEGY IS YOUR POWER So if you are a student of average and have no passion and happy with the 9 to 5 job you should be at a job .there will be not as many problems and it will be secure for you. but if you have a big idea and you are passionate about your dreams. You should be a businessman. Your proper guide is on this site, this guide will help you for success, how you can be an expert in the business. Once I was in network marketing. And almost I have all the ideas of all formats. Read more here https://www.no1gentlemanlifes.com/2019/07/how-to-choose-career-after-education.html

Hi Bippul, I do understand that making the right career choice is often overwhelming. Particularly these days when we keep on reading about so many different kinds of courses as well as careers, it makes it all the more confusing. Moreover, there is a lot of free advice available from everyone - peers, friends, relatives, acquaintances to add to that confusion.  All of us always desire to have the best in life. Being best in terms of salary, company profile, job role and other perks is what success means to us. However, in my opinion, a career is something where you are making a choice for entire life so a career is best if you feel happy doing it. Going to the office or workplace every day does not make you feel burdened or heavy in any way. Therefore it is important to discover your talents, personality type, strengths and aptitude. Getting a psychometric assessment done for yourself will be greatly helpful. A career that is in sync to these will be the best career option for you as you won’t have to struggle to excel. For example, Sachin Tendulkar may be a star cricketer but if you put him into singing he may struggle. Besides while making a career choice you also need to consider your life’s goals like whether money is important to you or fame or Prestige. Some of us want a career that pays us well but should not bind us in terms of schedule and time which means Freedom is important. For a few a career is good that also allows them to have some leisure time at the end of the day. For some, a career is best that allows them to be of service to others. So you see each one of us have different goals in life and it is very important that whichever career we choose should be in sync to these goals so that we remain happy or content doing it. Last but not least your strong or favourite subjects also play a role in determining your career domain. Hope this helps  #Latityude #SonilaMishra

Firstly, deciding a career depends on the stream you studied from. Like-- career options for science students are different than students of commerce. For eg. Being a humanity student, you cannot choose medical and being science student, you cannot choose to be a C.A. Secondly, you need to look into your interests and choices as well.. Search up for the choices you have regarding the career according to your subject and see what interests you the most. Thirdly, choose to do what you enjoy the most. for eg. if biology is fun to study, then you should not go for engineering. Because that will bore you and you will find it difficult to study, learn or understand. opt for something related to what you like or love to do. It will make the work easy and life full of joy instead of stress and anxiety. It will also make you the best in that field.. Fourthly, see what is best for you or what will be best for you in your future. Else follow your heart and passion as well as listen to the advise your mind gives you. Even if you choose a field, it has many more option/opportunities in them. for eg. medical is divided into hundreds of branches further. so choose wisely. that’s it. If you are passionate about something, you will for sure achieve it. Do not hesitate to grab any opportunities your life throws at you. Remember, risk takers are build up to be achievers. hope my answer was of any help to you. May life comes to you with ease, joy and glory. Have a good day.

Be prodent, long answer!!!! Being a average student who recently finished 12th, I landed into the most vex part of my school life “which career path i should choose” as i was never a person who wanted to pursue engineering so I started my search on Google regarding career options, looking out for entrance exams etc. Believe me I was totally exhausted in this process some suggestions were to pursue bsc, some suggested to prepare for engineering exams and what not. I was not convinced by any career path and the situation for me in this interval of time was that if anyone asked me what am I gonna do after 12th I would just burst out of anger on him/her and belonging to a orthodox family suggestions of my progenitor were only engineering or govenment exams and because of all these exhortations ,I became numb and my mind was completely blank . But then I decided to have a self talk and I suggest this self talk to everyone who is confused about career path. Just ask what will be the job you wanna pursue, a job in which even if any problem happens you will solve out without panic and anxiety. Think of the job which suits you in which you wanna gain knowledge more and more and after landing to your answer google up exams related to that job, universities that provide courses regarding it, don't just opt for a field which your friends are pursuing have a self talk ….you will definitely get your answer. All the best!!!!! :-)

Once the celebration or the brooding subsides , the question that haunts the parents and students is what next? Those who are interested in medical or engineering or CA will already be taking steps in that direction. For the others , here are a few suggestions 1. Forcing a decision on the kid can be a disaster.Equally disastrous will be leaving the kid alone to make the decision. 2. Parents must provide the kid with information about various courses, their requirements, content as well as future prospects. 3. Humanities and pure sciences is NOT the correct choice for those who are not extremely talented in this http://field.An average student of a engineering, commerce or technical degree has better career prospects. In humanities the job opportunities are extremely limited and competition is very high. 4. Along with graduation, equal focus must be given on skill training. In all probability, that additional certification or skill and not your degree will get you a job. 5.Choosing a degree course on the basis of Civil Services exam syllabus is a complete waste. Look at the data, most people who qualify have degrees that have nothing to do with UPSC syllabus. 6. Don't choose on the basis of what you like, choose on the basis of what you are good at and what the market needs. There is a difference between hobbies/interests and profession. For those who couldn't pass , believe me in the long run the failure will have an impact only if you let it psychologically affect you. Else a year or two , here and there is absolutely insignificant. Be happy and conquer the world. All the best.

You can base your decision on multiple choices! Do you want to make money or want to follow the passion you have for the things that excites you the most in life. Choosing a career path might be a little tricky sometimes! I was stuck in a similar warp where I couldn't decide whether to opt for science or commerce. Numbers were something that never excited me much and I had a good knowledge of all my science subjects. The teachers in our education system are not programmed to shape a pupils career. We are taught a plethora of things which usually is not applied in the real world. I had two options where I was inclined more to choose science. However, back in those days you never had anyone to guide you through your career. You have career consultants and all but no one prepares you on what will you be doing when you land that dream job. There are a couple of websites like OnTheJob who gave me legit insight into what happens behind the scenes. Masterclass also helps you curate your options. I hope you get clarity on your career and fly out with passing colors.

It is important to understand that choosing a career is a continuous procedure and a student must choose a career at every step of the way. Whether you are deciding a stream in class 11, whether you are contemplating what course to pursue in college, whether you are deciding to pursue a post graduate degree, or whether the student is planning on what career profile to get into. Therefore, one can follow the following steps to choose a career: In the first instance, evaluate your capabilities. · What are you good at? · What are your strengths? · What is your aptitude? · What is it that you do that doesn’t require unnecessary additional effort and you succeed in or perform that task quite naturally with much ease? If you are not quite sure of your inherent strengths & capabilities, then it is very important that you take an aptitude test and personality test to know your true potential. Secondly, draw a flow chart of your academic qualifications and compare it with the options available with you in the market. Thirdly, match / connect your capabilities with your academic status. A person can choose from a myriad of careers related to his/her stream. But not all of these careers will be the best fit career for an individual. This is because each career option requires different aptitude and personality combinations. That is why, it is important to connect one’s own capabilities with ones academic qualifications. This can be a little tricky as even though one may be able to figure out one’s aptitude and personality through psychometric tests like aptitude testing and personality assessment, however, it becomes quite a task to match ones strength with the requirements of the hundreds of career options available in the market. Hope this clear your doubts.

It’s good to know that you are in for choices. Otherwise some students these days just go the one of the three undergraduate degrees regardless of their likes and dislikes. Anyways, there are many conventional methods like aptitude tests and counselling that students refer to these days but before you go for all that I would request you to sit with yourself and find out your passions and interests in life. Think and finalize your goals like what you want to become- a professional, a business person or into academia, till what level you wish to pursue your education- Bachelors, Masters or PhD, MBA, Professional courses like MBBS, CA, CFA, Engineering, etc, where do you dream to study- which country or rather, which university, where do see yourself in the next 10 years- do you see yourself working in a corporate company, or travelling the world while working, doing a business and so on, what kind of a life you want- rich, middle class, upper middle class, famous, intellectual, devotional and spiritual, a volunteer for society, etc (You can choose more than one options bdw :p) And don’t worry, since you are discussing with yourself, no fear of judgments. Once you have answers to all these questions, you can probably make better a choice. After that shortlist some career paths and your major from design, literature, arts, commerce, different sciences, finance and many more. Then, finally, discuss with your family and get their suggestions and views, because after all you don’t study alone, your family is by your side in every pain and gain throughout. So consider their approval and thought. Hope I was able to help. All the best.

As you know after 12th our main career starts... Till 10th we didn't have an option to choose our own subjects. From 11th we started making some decisions in our career path. Ok now let's get to the point. First thing I am not that clear that exactly what you have done in your 12th. Where you from science commerce or arts background. But now I will be focusing on the thing that is happening all over the world, COVID-19. Because of this COVID-19, many new careers are coming up, and with these new career fields new courses are also coming up. Like. 1) Epidemics 2) Natural Disasters 3) Geopolitics: Managing Global Business and Financial Uncertainty 4) COVID-19 and the Science of Epidemiology 5) Building Organisational Resilience 6) Pandemic Response CoLab 7) COVID-19, Global Markets, and Global Microeconomic Policy Responses 8) Crisis Management for Leaders 9) Accessing the Challenge and Making an Impact All these new courses are coming up and universities like MIT, London Business School, Johns Hopkins University, Harvard Business School, University of Pennsylvania, etc are launching these courses. Many courses are available on Coursera. You can check them out. Further, if I did not answer your question correctly, because of not totally understanding your situation, you can message me on Quora and I'll try to reply to you. All the best for your career... Hello, After 12th you have many more career option in those option Vocational courses to choose after 12th is best option for you…here is the details about the course check it : Vocational Courses deal with the industry-friendly skills are provided to the candidates into the diverse of the fields and the aim at the preparing of them so for the dedicated career into the course of the program. These are focused on the advancement of the career as they are direct to the industrial and the job perspective view. There are the vocational courses which confirm that the specific candidate possesses the essential skills required in the particular profession.  Few of the popular vocational courses in India are : Audio Technicians One can opt for the certificate and the course over the audio engineering that imparts the knowledge on the technical side of the music and the broadcasting communications. These technicians are also in charge of the relevant equipment which records the music and the audio tracks. The job prospect is promising and many of the big and the small houses hire such skilled professionals. Foreign Language Expert With businesses witnessing a boom all over the world and the world becoming a global village fast, demands for the foreign language experts are seeing an all-time high. The primary job responsibility of the language expert is to communicate with foreign clients mostly about the company’s product range and the services. Game Designer The game designers also design for the video game and the needs which are to be technologically sound to be an as huge amount for the technicality is being involved into the designing in the every single video game and the definite of the computer software which are used to design the new age advanced video games for the nation. Air Hostess Training Air Hostess is also here trained. In India, the number of private institutions also here provide the degree, diploma and the Certificate in the Air Hostess training programs. Duration of these courses varies on the nature of the program. However, in the course of the time of the Air Hostess training lasts between one to two years. This is also highly the coveted job and also the aviation courses, which have a great number of the takers. Electrical Technician An electrical technician makes, maintains and also repairs to the electrical connections and the fittings, the install and the maintenance of the wiring, the control over the lighting systems at homes, the offices or the factories. With the dependence over the electrical products, the increase over the technicians is much in the demand for the purpose of the servicing and the maintenance. The job responsibilities here are the repairing, the upgradation of the electronics equipment and the systems. Photography Professional photographers are also here in great demand. The course in the photography would make one understand over the situations into a different perspective by the efficiently implementing the lighting techniques and the positioning of the subjects thus giving the specific Direction to th lucrative career. The career options of this course field lie in the field of the photojournalism, the Fashion and Advertising, Nature and the Wildlife, Travel or the Event Photography. One can also launch to the career as the assistant photographer or also head for the website design agencies or van starts working as the freelancer. Photojournalism is known to be the exciting field which requires the clicking of the newsworthy images………READ MORE Hope this answer will help youGood luck!

Choosing the right career is essential and 11th and 12th are the years where you can take this decision. Once you choose the subjects at the school and undergraduate level they are likely to impact career options throughout one’s life. An assessment of aptitude, personality, interest, orientation style as well as EQ is very essential. Apart from this knowledge about the careers as well as the kind of job life and salary expectations are to be known so that the individual can make informed choices. You can meet with a career expert who has in depth knowledge and expertise which can help one make the right decision. Apart from this working on skillset, improving aptitude and gaining knowledge is essential. Reading up and researching about the careers that a person likes is essential to understand the current trends as well as changes in the particular career and industry. Hope this helps Prachi Luthra Career Coach

Choose a course that suits your interestes, aptitute work-related value and personality-type. While you should also consider earnings, job outlook, and duties, the industry, the job role, the location, the pay, the lifestyle etc. nothing contributes more to job satisfaction than matching your occupation to your character traits and motivations. Look into what you like to be doing the rest of your life without getting bored…!!! This is the initial and crucial stage of building a career. Do not take the decision with puzzled and ambiguous mind and end up selecting a wrong stream there by opening the door to worst consequences in the long-term career prospects. Take your time….think wisely….and then decide what suits you better !!!! because only you know yourself better than anyone else does..you know your strengths..!!!! and what you exactly want in your life!!!!!

"OK, I know all that, but I have less than 50% marks in my 12th exam, now tell me what career options am I left with?" There are plenty of career options and courses available after 12th even if you have scored less in the exam. We have listed a few courses and career options you can pursue even if you have not got a high score in your class 12 board exams: Fashion Designing If you always like dressing up nicely, know what the latest trend in fashion industry is and have a knack for good design in clothes, you can join a course in fashion designing. You require just 45% average Photography: You see beauty in the simple things around you, you appreciate technology, and you have the sense of colours, join a photography course and take up a similar course for graduation through distance learning or by enrolling in a university programme. You can apply to institutes. Acting/ dance/ music If you think you have it in you, join a course in performing arts, like acting, music or dance.  in this video you get all the important information about carrer option for 12th paas student and also 12th fail student in aal field. if this video useful for you then dont forget to subscribe our you tube channel and also dont forget to share this video and also like this video. if you watch this video then thank you for your love.

Well, the first thing you need to realise is that no one can tell you what to pursue!People around you can simply guide you to as to which field is better. To live a satisfied life, you need to introspect: your interests, your strong points and your shortcomings.It is not a thumb rule to go for courses like M.B.B.s, B.Tech., Law or some related courses. Go for the course or field which you are comfortable with. There are plenty of opportunities for you, its just you need to figure out your interest and simply go, join that field! This is the age when you are too confused and there is lot of “unwanted pressure”.Just stay calm and go for what you like.

Choosimg the rught career has always been a “pain in the ass” situation especially when u live in India as there is lot of pressure from the family and in maximum cases students have to go with the family’s decision. I would suggest this to every class12th student that firstly u should explore yourself and know wht your interest is,wht your passion is and wht u want to eo with your life after that prioritize your life. This thing has to be done in 10th class only as in 11th students have to choose the stream. So depending upon your intrest choose the stream in 10th and then dedicate yourselves to that stream,explore the possible career options related to the stream and then u can sort out the options depending upon your personnal interests and trust me if u listen to yourself and work according to that u will be unbeatable in the market. Dont go with the decision of your family as its you who has to face the consequences or the benefits. So do whatever your heart says,choose a career u r interested in not your parents. Good luck.

There are various career options available after 12th for the students. The question arises among the streams and majorly the specific course to opt for. Every course has its own pros and cons. One must really go through every aspect before selecting a particular course for the future. If you’re still confused, you can take the help of a career counselor. The expert guidance and tips definitely help you to select the right path for you. One such counselor I have interacted with is CareerPotli. These guys have a well designed and developed curriculum for the students. Their assessment test, interactive session and the whole counseling framework helps you to find the right and the best career path for you. You can directly visit the website to contact them or even through social media.

This is the question of almost every student of classes 10th –12th. Since there are a number of options so students get confused. I suggest you to first evaluate yourself, observe your attitude your aspirations and think what you want to do. Try to look inside yourself. Think what kind of work gives you maximum satisfaction and then decide your goal and then work accordingly. As you have not mentioned your subject combination which is a limitation for me to advise you more accurately. I don't know whether you're a student of humanities or commerce or science. If you are a student of science even then I need to know your subject combination. Anyway let me try to help you. If you are a student of science having a combination of PCM then you must go for engineering from a good institute. Suppose in future if you want to switch to administrative job you can go there as well or if you want a career in teaching even that option will remain open as after B. Tech you can go for MS. If you have a combination of PCB then you should and must prepare for NEET and other MBBS entrance exams. If you are a student having the background of commerce then you have an option for Chartered Accountancy, Cost Accountancy, Company Secretary, MBA(finance) and obviously B. Com then M. Com, then B. Ed and PhD. If you have a background of humanities then too you may go for teaching, welfare officer (for the graduates and post graduates of Sociology) etc. So first think and then decide. I suggest you if you have any such questions in future then please mention your subjects so that you may get more relevant answers. Thanks!

No one on this earth and to that matter, even God can't give you an appropriate answer. ASK YOUR HEART. Don't let anyone else decide for you. Sit alone, take a note pad or a rough book and go on writing whatever you have on your mind about your career. After you are done, read it again and again. I'm sure your eyes, heart and mind will surely stop at one point. Observe which that one is and think if it that you want. Decision done.

After completing 12 th standard,one should have the capacity to think on their own ,they should not depend on others decision, instead one should be able to take their own decision.Coming to career point of view you have to select the course in which you are interested like if you are interested in finding how things work its better to pursue B.tech,and if you are interested in teaching you can take Bsc or if you are a medical student it is better to Continue with MBBS and other related degrees and the most important thing you have to remember while taking a decision is about your interest and curiosity,without interest you cant do anything.So take a correct decision.All the best!!!!!

Get your ideas and goals right. Don't get pressurised by your parents or by anyone.Its your life , you gotta make your own decision whether you want to make a career in educational field, sports,arts etc. Don't choose a career based on money only if you have no interest in it. Making career choices after 12th play a very crucial role in your career path. Therefore, it is important to make the right choice. For this first, you need to determine what your strength and weakness are, don’t just choose a course just because everyone is asking you; make sure it interests you. Also, one should always choose a course over the college brand because ending with a course which doesn’t interest you at a famous college won’t solve the purpose.

I have been there. I know how clueless students are after completing their 12th. I guess the best way to take a decision is to close your eyes and imagine what you truly want to be. Think what you enjoy doing. Think the interests and passions that you went to when you were bored. Did you play outdoor games a lot or scribbled on notebooks when you were younger? Do you enjoy dancing or like working on computers? Whenever we think of career, we think of jobs that involves mental capacity. But there are many careers that can be followed with mind and passion. I know it is easily said than one. If you are looking for a more practical way, then, I recommend speaking to a education and career consultant. He or she will be able to add more clarity and also approach the topic in a rational manner. I know a website where you can speak with career and education consultants through chat and email. Here are links to the pages that host leading career and education consultants of India: http://quikconsult.com/career-consultants/ http://quikconsult.com/education-consultants/ NOTE: QuikConsult is a paid platform to seek advice online. I hope my answer helps you in making the right career choice.

As we all know that choosing the right career after 12th is very crucial as this is the time when you decide which route you want to take in life. So before, you start looking for 12th pass outs careers you must keep three important points in mind. The points mentioned below will help in making the right decision. 1. First and the foremost thing is to determine your strength and weakness. Don’t choose any course or institution just because your friends will be there or because your parents want you to join it. It is always better to figure out what your strengths are and choose what you really want. 2. Always give more weightage to the course than the college brand. 3. It is better to avoid a year gap because staying motivated for the entire year sitting at home can be really difficult.

Make your goal perfect,your goal only mentor in your way.Choosing right course here is great foundation for your career.Don’t go upon popular courses if you are not interested. Selecting the right course and college is a very significant decision after 12th because the right selection will lead to a gratifying career as the wrong one is equal to ending up in studying a subject or a sphere that doesn’t really interest you.
